intro: Gagea × theobaldii, commonly known as the hybrid gagea, is a species native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure and delicate, grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered at the base of the leaves. Gagea × theobaldii thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and woodland settings. Its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements make it a popular choice among gardeners interested in native flora.
